resources.string: This section contains settings regarding your events which are used to group insulin doses and blood glucose readings: \n \nEdit Events: Allows you to edit the events that take place throughout your day.

This section contains settings regarding your contact details, which are used exclusively for populating fields in PDFs generated on export: 
 
Contact Name: Your full name. 
 
Contact Number: Your mobile or telephone number.
BGL range value must be higher than the previous value and lower than the next
BGL range value cannot be empty

This section contains settings regarding the coloured highlighting of your blood glucose data: 
 
Highlighting Enabled: When enabled, your blood glucose readings will be coloured red, yellow, or green to indicate how well the reading falls into you desired range. 
 
Ideal Range (mmol/L): The lower and upper limit of the range you would consider ideal for a blood glucose reading. Values within this range will be coloured green. 
 
High Range (mmol/L): The lower and upper limit of the range you would consider higher than ideal for a blood glucose reading, bit not necessarily a problem. Values within this range will be coloured yellow. 
 
Reset BGL Values: Resets the lower and upper limits for your ideal and high ranges to the values suggested by the app.

This section contains settings regarding your target blood glucose readings before and after a meal, which are used exclusively for populating fields in PDFs generated on export: 
 
Pre-meal blood glucose range (mmol/L): The lower and upper limit of the range of your expected blood glucose level readings before you have eaten. 
 
Post-meal blood glucose range (mmol/L): The lower and upper limit of the range of your expected blood glucose level readings after you have eaten. 
 
Set From BGL Highlighting Values: Sets the lower and upper limits for your pre-meal and post-meal blood glucose readings to match the lower and upper limits in the blood glucose level highlighting section.
